titleStmt.title: F. M. Keith to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1544

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Military Correspondence, 1863-1867

creation.placeName: Covington, Kenton County, Kentucky; Newport, Campbell County, Kentucky

body.p:
HEAD QUARTERS MILITARY COMMANDANT,
COVINGTON AND NEWPORT, KY.,
Decr 3d 1863
Govr Bramlette
Gov

I cordially concur in the statements made by Genl G. C. Smith to you of date Novr 28th 1863. in relation to Capt Bloom. And I also say that in my opinion his appointment to the Lt. Colonelcy will never be a cause of regret.

F M Keith Lt Col
1st Regt O V H A Comdg Post.
